discussion.content:
Replicating a Volume
The Block Volume service provides you with the capability to perform ongoing automatic asynchronous replication of block volumes, boot volumes, and volume groups to other regions and availability domains.

There are two types of replication:

Cross region, for replication between regions.
Cross availability domain, for replication between availability domains within the same region.

en you enable replication for a volume or volume group, the process includes an initial sync of the data from the source to the replica. Depending on volume size and amount of data written to volumes, this sync can take hours. After the initial synchronization process is complete, the replication process is continuous, with the typical Recovery Point Object (RPO) target rate being less than thirty minutes for replication across regions, however the RPO can vary.
